data.message: Facebook's Messenger requires to much of your personal info... They want access to yours identity, contacts/calendar, location, sms, phone, photos/media/files, camera/microphone, WiFi connection information and device IDL information... Crazy man and too much... What are you doing with all  that info?

replies.message: We understand your concerns, Henry. Almost all apps must ask for permissions to run. Your trust is important to us and we encourage you to learn more about how Messenger actually uses these permissions here: http://on.fb.me/1xQ5fCK . -Jenny
Really? Who are you selling the info to?

I am using Internet on my android phone and should say, from my personal experience that actually almost all apps, specifically messenger have permission to access and use our private information mostly without informing the users, and the important and seriously dangerous catastrophe happens when these apps being  malfunction or abuse by hackers who by controlling all the system of phone would be able to get whole information through these apps.

Due to the fact that Facebook has chosen to involve software that will allow the theft of my personal information. At this date of December 1, 2014, in response to the new guidelines of Facebook, pursuant to articles L.111, 112 and 113 of the code of intellectual property, I declare that my rights are attached to all my personal data drawings, paintings, photos, video, texts etc. published on my profile and my page. For commercial use of the foregoing, my written consent is required at all times.  By this statement, I tell Facebook that it is strictly forbidden to disclose, copy, distribute, broadcast, or take any other action against me on the basis of this profile and or its content. The content of my profile contains private information. The violation of my privacy is punishable by law (UCC 1-308 1-308 1-103 and the Rome Statute).
Kamego's Kamego I highly suggest you read this. http://www.snopes.com/computer/facebook/privacy.asp
